text: We have a Sommely meeting hold for Monday to map out resources and effort for the Sommely MVP product. I think it’d be helpful to review the feature spreadsheet Rob created as a baseline. I’ll take a pass at an agenda today for review tomorrow.
Thanks Marce. What are your thoughts on adding a designer to the mix? I'll reformat worksheet into a GAANt like chart for us to work from
would be good - can we check on who’s avail?
and it’s currently and 8:30 - 1pm meeting but we can adjust that if needed.
Can sommely benefit from sound design? Elise and I discussed the cap making a pop sound when removed from the bottle
i like the idea of sound design. but i think simulating a bottle popping noise (when the bottle should theoretically still be sealed) could be… disorienting?
but i do like the idea of a noise signifying the change in status

My 2 cents is that the ROI of sound and potential UX trade-offs from it (how loud does it have to be to be effective? Is that volume loud enough to disrupt a sleeping baby? Is the sound universally loved? And if not, do enough people love it enough to justify the few who hate it) make it exclusionary, but I think it does have the potential to be a cool micro interaction, so who am I to say
Also if you have rows and rows of wine racks, could sound help you find the right wine at the right time?
Find My Wine
Now with Apple Watch :watch: integration

i love the attention to how things sound - think that can be down to the physicality and materials - does a foam give a satisfying whoosh to let you know it's snug? do you get a grolsch-flip-top like "floop" when you pull it off? those add to the experience - an artificial facsimile of a natural sound has the potential to sound, well artificial, and repetitive, like the mario coin cha-ching of a bodega cash register
sound is a huge part of an experience, but it also can be innate to the materials
Well said <@U06DFL7BP>
i spent HOURS trying to get the right key fob click for the zipcar iphone app, once upon a time
it was maddening. but ultimately satisfying.
wonder if it’s still in there
Did yuh work with Robin Chase?
doesn’t ring a bell. it was 2009-2011
I love how the apple Taptic Engine has changed the way things feel without and the audible sound of the vibration motor
related: try clicking your iphone 7 home button with the bottom right speaker covered

Oh she's the founder. Reading her book (Peers Inc) now and it's great so, top of mind :p haptic could be interesting too. could be used for when putting a cap back on, to signal the connection had been made/cap has seeded appropriately?
oh - never met her! worked mostly with the CTO - Luke Schnieder.
unrelated to sound design (I have some horror stories about Mini Cooper website sound design circa 2005) Sommely is getting shipped out to Santa Clara
to their EBC
What?!?
that was always the intent
shashi can help set it up in SC
Great visibility
and if we want to send someone down we can
Ha I just feel like I'm behind on the second one :)
Rob could you and Miguel coordinate w/ Shashi on a teardown date?
<@U06DFL7BP>: feels and sounds different
<@U026NB2U2>: sure
thanks <@U0B9N0HF0>!
Should I be in on that Monday meeting?
I didn't get an invite.
<@U026NB2U2> is this the product feature spreadsheet? <https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZKuuI2EFKW7JPqHvi6eO9mweb2BKUBP5uGr9NQ0_Is0/edit?usp=sharing>

<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iuRZ4mpGjCK6n-vmPyg8SZDi-gf_j9F_gOcnkUMWEJU/edit#gid=0>
<@U0B9N0HF0|rob> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/rob/F3CGA8L77/user_stories_|Sommely Phases/Epics/User Stories>
Ive become terrible at finding things in drive

haha. Lee, in that document, on the 3rd tab, is 1.0 Project Plan.  This is a first pass attempt at timeline for the digital component. Mind taking a look and calling out anything that looks suspicious/missing?

So after communicating the TI board designer, the earliest we would get boards for test would be early January. Which means 2nd or 3rd week. I sent an email to Marce asking for $ to buy 10. We should receive a second board this week or early  next week. So I can begin coding. These boards can be used as both hub and cap.
Looks good actually
By end of jan, new small board design should be done
which can be done in parallel with industrial design
so yeah, only thing missing is ID
Cool. Yeah, hope is that HW+ID is complete prior to starting the software sprint
<@U026NB2U2> should we try to stalk CEO of vivino while in SF next week?
vivino is a 0.3 mile walk from where Riverwood is
Interesting - I’m down for stalking
I was also going to ping Ryan Vinyard (who has nor relation to wine but did write the book the Hardware Startup and is now at Molekule)
I heard back from the former CEO of Swirl It (I’d met her a few years ago at SXSW). She worked on a pretty extensive wine DB and though her startup failed, she still has it. I asked her about it.
Curious how we’d want to evaluate it to see if it could handle image recognition requests - I’m not even sure they have labels or just data, but I can ask.
i remember her
Evans met her I believe in SF
or Nick Parish
why I have them both blocked out in my head is beyond me

Starting point for Monday’s convo - still need to add a few things.
Super helpful. Thanks Marce
it links into the priority spreadsheet but presents that data a bit more abstractly and cleanly
Agreed
working on a milestone calendar / prioritization table
btw I’ve been connected to <http://www.root.vc/#rootventures> CEO via my brother in law

ok cool. Thanks

no antennas needed
if you want an intro to the CEO Avi, I can arrange it
I’ll take the intro - and will get the order in now
ordered. need 19 more people to buy it...
maybe Shashi can jump in on it...
He can give us a few Edison's. the rest we need to buy from mouser. Should be $57 each
cool. we’re still a few weeks away from those things shipping - let’s see what he can source and go from there.

First pass at a milestone-based funding + resource spreadsheet.
Ignore the second two tabs, they were scratch notes for me
what does Cost plus ($100) mean?
basic idea is that we would do the work at a discount, but not a loss - so at cost plus a small markup.
cool
love this business planning stuff

Against my normal suggestions, I’m going to throw out a suggestion to keep costs down. Since this application will mostly be API based, we could convert android and and ios devs to a react native front end and back end dev
this guy does the best react native front end stuff ive seen: <https://twitter.com/browniefed>

attachments.title: Jason Brown (@browniefed) | Twitter
attachments.text: The latest Tweets from Jason Brown (@browniefed). I wish I made hard cider for a living. We're all wrong, especially me. I do @reactjs, #reactnative, and @eggheadio. Portland, Oregon

text: I also bet a Mo or JohnC could do this stuff if they had some play time
neat - will check out . I can lower the dev costs to one per platform as well - I was trying to map out the most extensive case scenario
to deliver on multiple platforms
and I’m always down for folks learning new things as well, which would be neat
